intro: Mascagnia pubiflora var. parnahybensis, commonly known as the Parnaíba nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades and tomatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom at night. It produces small, yellow berries that contain toxic seeds. This species is adapted to tropical climates and is often found in dry, open habitats.
